alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 8:28PM CDT until March 13 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Band of Moderate Snow over Central Wisconsin... .The heaviest snow set up just east of Taylor county, however we continue to see a very narrow band of moderate snow pivot through Clark County this evening. The visibilities have mostly been 3/4 of a mile to 3 miles, however visibilities could briefly drop to 1/2 mile with any snow increases. Some locations will continue to see an inch or two of snow this evening as this band drops south and pulls eastward. Northeast winds will increase later this evening leading to some blowing and drifting of snow over roads with continued slick conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one or two inches. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Some blowing and drifting of snow with increasing northeast winds.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
